content:
Diagnosis:
Papillary thyroid carcinoma, T1aN0M0

Surgery:
15 January 2024 - Total thyroidectomy

Histology:
Well-differentiated papillary thyroid carcinoma, 0.8cm, no extrathyroidal extension, margins clear. NTRK fusion negative.

Treatment:
Radioactive iodine ablation 1.1GBq completed 12 March 2024

Current situation:
Post-treatment whole body scan shows no evidence of residual disease or metastases

Thyroid function:
TSH 0.02 (suppressed as planned)
fT4 22.4 (within target range)

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 175mcg daily

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radioactive iodine ablation treatment. She has recovered well with no significant side effects from the treatment. Mild dry mouth has now completely resolved. She reports good energy levels and has returned to work full time. Examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features in the neck.

The post-ablation whole body scan shows no evidence of residual disease or metastatic uptake. Thyroglobulin is undetectable (<0.1) with negative thyroglobulin antibodies, indicating excellent response to treatment.

The plan is to continue current dose of levothyroxine maintaining TSH suppression. She will have thyroid function tests with GP in 6 weeks. Follow up appointment arranged for 6 months with thyroglobulin measurement.
